text: The Standing Long Jump event at the 1926 Women's World Games in Gothenburg at the Slottsskogsvallen was the second time the standing long jump was held at Women's World Games. The event took place on the last day of the Games on 29 August 1926. Japanese Kinue Hitomi won the event with a distance of 2.49 metres, ahead of Czechoslovak Zdena Smolová and British Barbara Holliday. ==Results== Rank Name Nationality Distance (m) Notes Kinue Hitomi 2.49 Zdena Smolová 2.47 Barbara Holliday 2.37 4 Märtha Johansson 2.29 5 Florence Birchenough 2.2? 6 Vera Jacobssen 2.28 7 Evelyne Cloupet 2.22 8 ? ? ? 9 Lucienne Laudré-Viel 2.09 Source: ==References== ==Other websites== * Image of Kinue Hitomi during the event (winner) * Image of Kinue Hitomi during the event (winner) * Image of Zdena Smolová during the event (runner-up) Category:1926 Women's World Games
title: 1926 Women's World Games – standing long jump
